item.title: Broken down chain link fence and rubbish, 26th November
item.description:
After clearing some weeds for a fence repair this chain link fence has been uncovered. It is dangerously with sharp metal spikes sticking out and it has collected lots of unsafe sharp rubbish which is again dangerous. A dog has injured herself on it already and this could happen again or to a child. The fence needs to be safely removed and the rubbish cleared urgently.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Avington Grove, Penge, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Constant Littering, Litter flying from a window, 26th November
item.description:
There is someone who constantly throws litter out their windows and over their fence. Sometimes it hits the communal foot pathway, sometimes it drops on the communal garden area, and sometimes it ends up in our private garden. This is not the first time it happens. Happening next to the fence of 9 Moreton House.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gataker Street, Bermondsey, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Piles of rotten leaves that haven’t been cleaned up for months, 26th November
item.description:
Durham Road is still being ignored when it comes to street cleaning! From the junction with Durham Ave towards Westmoreland Road it is absolutely filthy. The leaves are never cleaned and lay rotting in deep piles of mulch. As a result all the drains are blocked and there is litter everywhere. Because the street is in such a state it is regularly used by fly tippers. The only street cleaning we get is a road sweeper driving up the middle of the road due to the parked cars which doesn’t pick up a thing. All the rotting leaves and rubbish are by the kerbs and on the footpaths which are becoming slippery and dangerous. CAN WE HAVE OUR STREET CLEANED PLEASE, STOP NEGLECTING DURHAM RD!!!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Durham Road, Shortlands, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Corner of Kylemore Rd and Hemstal Rd, 26th November
item.description:
There is a missing no left turn on the corner, which makes people take the one way road against the traffic, causing near miss accidents. There is at the top of the road but not at this junction, which must be rectified to avoid traffic accidents or pedestrians casualties
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 36, Hemstal Road, Kilburn, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
